greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Base -2 representation of -n reinterpreted as binary.
reference: M. Gardner, Knotted Doughnuts and Other Mathematical Entertainments. Freeman, NY, 1986, p. 101.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: Joerg Arndt, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: a(4) = 12 because the negabinary representation of -4 is 1100, and in ordinary binary that is 12.
a(5) = 15 because the negabinary representation of -5 is 1111, and in binary that is 15.
mathematica: (* This function comes from the Weisstein page *)
Negabinary[n_Integer] := Module[{t = (2/3)(4^Floor[Log[4, Abs[n] + 1] + 2] - 1)}, IntegerDigits[BitXor[n + t, t], 2]];
xref: Complement of A005351 in natural numbers.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
